title:
A novel method to indirectly reconstruct neutrinos in collider
  experiments
abstract:
The inclusive tagging method is a highly efficient reconstruction approach,
especially in beauty-physics experiments. In this Letter, we introduce an
innovative inclusive-tagging scheme that is capable of capturing the
four-momentum of an undetected particle on the signal side, such as a neutrino,
K_L^0, etc., in collider experiments. This proposed scheme, based on an
asymptotically recursive vector sequence, has the potential to catalyze a
significant transformation in the capabilities of the inclusive tagging method
and might also have promising applications in other fields.
